newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah stable in slow late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah stable in slow late trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was stable against the dollar in slow late trading on Monday as a raise in the central bank fixing failed to have much impact on the market, dealers said.
"The new fixing briefly pushed the dollar up, but it fell back again to earlier levels due to a lack of fresh factors," one European bank dealer said.
The central bank, Bank Indonesia, raised its intervention rate by one point to 2,324.00/2,516.00 and the conversion rate to 2,324.00/2,372.
Dealers said the market had been slow since the opening in anticipation of the move.
They said the central bank usually did not raise the fixing on Mondays, but surprising rises last week had prompted speculation of a one point rise in the afternoon.
Dealers said foreign operators were generally staying on the sidelines due to a lack of fresh factors.
Dealers said spot rupiah was last quoted at 2,323.90/24.00 against an opening of 2,323.50/24.50.
